consumer module¶

class consumer.Consumer[source]¶

Bases: object

This is the class from which the program is controlled. It can be used together with the handler module in order to communicate with an external client over a websocket

Parameters:
  • concept_map (ConceptMap) – The concept map object containing references to nodes and edges
  • SOURCES (list[string]) – All of the sources referenced to in the edges of the concept map
  • user (User) – The active user
add_descriptives(gender, birthdate, code)[source]¶

Adds the provided descriptives to the active user

Parameters:
  • gender (string) – The gender of the user (restricted to ‘male’, ‘female’, or ‘other’)
  • birthdate (datetime) – The date of birth of the user
  • code (string) – A code affirming receiving the informed consent form
add_test(flashcards_dict, items_dict)[source]¶

Adds a test.Test to the active user.User

Parameters:
  • flashcards_dict (dict) – A dictionary containing flashcard id’s and answers
  • items_dict (dict) – A dictionary containing test item id’s and answers
authenticate(name)[source]¶

A function to either return an existing user.User or a new user.User based on the given name

Parameters:name (string) – The username
Returns:The user with this username
Return type:User
consumer(keyword, data, user)[source]¶

Pass data to the function corresponding to the provided keyword for the provided user

Parameters:
  • keyword (string) – the keyword for which function to use
  • data (dict) – the data necessary for executing the function
Returns:

Contains the keyword and data to send over a websocket to a client
Return type:

dict
create_questionnaire()[source]¶

Creates a new questionnaire.Questionnaire

Returns:A new questionnaire
Return type:Questionnaire
create_test()[source]¶

Creates a new test.Test for the currently active user.User

Returns:A new test not containing items from previous tests
Return type:Test
